column4: is there a way to mask packages or tell apt that the packages are already installed, when in fact they aren't?
you can pin them with empty ones.. it's quite advanced...
with apt, or something else?
do I need to man dpkg?

you need to make your own repository, set your apt preferences to pin yours with a higher priority, then make empty packages with the name of the packages you don't want to see.. depending on what you want to achieve it may not be worth the hassle :)

well in this case all you need to do is to repackage netbeans.
that doesn't sound too hard
that's quite easy.. apt-get source netbeans... change debian/control file, then dpkg-buildpackage and here goes :)
